intro: Sideritis pusilla subsp. almeriensis, commonly known as the Almería dwarf ironwort, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, hairy leaves. It produces delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Sideritis pusilla subsp. almeriensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient plant in Mediterranean climates.
